feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [joomla/session] Joomla! Framework Remote Code Injection Vulnerability
entry.content:
The Session package 1.x before 1.3.1 for Joomla! Framework allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via unspecified session values.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2015-8566
  • https://developer.joomla.org/security-centre/637-20151205-session-remote-code-execution-vulnerability.html
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/joomla/session/CVE-2015-8566.yaml
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20160603093633/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/79197
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wwfh-28hx-w2r2

entry.title: [dompdf/dompdf] DOMPDF Arbitrary File Read
entry.content:
dompdf.php in dompdf before 0.6.1, when DOMPDF_ENABLE_PHP is enabled, allows context-dependent attackers to bypass chroot protections and read arbitrary files via a PHP protocol and wrappers in the input_file parameter, as demonstrated by a php://filter/read=convert.base64-encode/resource in the input_file parameter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2014-2383
  • https://github.com/dompdf/dompdf/commit/23a693993299e669306929e3d49a4a1f7b3fb028
  • http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2014/Apr/258
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/dompdf/dompdf/CVE-2014-2383.yaml
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20151215023329/http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/531912/100/0/threaded
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qr6q-w4gj-3865

entry.title: [pyrocms/pyrocms] PyroCMS Vulnerable to CSRF
entry.content:
PyroCMS 3.7 is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery (CSRF) via the admin/addons/uninstall/anomaly.module.blocks URI: an arbitrary plugin will be deleted.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-25263
  • https://gist.github.com/farid007/df51b0666643ec01d5571cbcc1e966e7
  • https://github.com/pyrocms/pyrocms
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vg2g-698h-v9w3

entry.title: [pyrocms/pyrocms] PyroCMS Vulnerable to CSRF
entry.content:
PyroCMS 3.7 is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery (CSRF) via the admin/pages/delete/ URI: pages will be deleted.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-25262
  • https://gist.github.com/farid007/2af454d909fa5a60a07e4e547e99964e
  • https://github.com/pyrocms/pyrocms
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-56xx-pv88-2662

entry.title: [laravel/framework] Laravel does not properly constrain the host portion of a password-reset URL
entry.content:
Laravel 5.4.x before 5.4.22 does not properly constrain the host portion of a password-reset URL, which makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct phishing attacks by specifying an attacker-controlled host.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-9303
  • https://laravel-news.com/laravel-5-4-22-is-now-released-and-includes-a-security-fix
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/98776
  • https://github.com/laravel/framework/commit/cef10551820530632a86fa6f1306fee95c5cac43
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/illuminate/auth/CVE-2017-9303.yaml
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/laravel/framework/CVE-2017-9303.yaml
  • https://laravel.com/docs/5.4/releases#laravel-5.4.22
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20171021180417/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/98776
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rc8x-jrrc-frfv

entry.title: [opensolutions/vimbadmin] ViMbAdmin CSRF Vulnerabilities
entry.content:
Multiple cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerabilities in the addAction and purgeAction functions in ViMbAdmin 3.0.15 allow remote attackers to hijack the authentication of logged administrators to

  1. add an administrator user via a crafted POST request to <vimbadmin directory>/application/controllers/DomainController.php,
  2. remove an administrator user via a crafted GET request to <vimbadmin directory>/application/controllers/DomainController.php,
  3. change an administrator password via a crafted POST request to <vimbadmin directory>/application/controllers/DomainController.php,
  4. add a mailbox via a crafted POST request to <vimbadmin directory>/application/controllers/MailboxController.php,
  5. delete a mailbox via a crafted POST request to <vimbadmin directory>/application/controllers/MailboxController.php,
  6. archive a mailbox address via a crafted GET request to <vimbadmin directory>/application/controllers/ArchiveController.php,
  7. add an alias address via a crafted POST request to <vimbadmin directory>/application/controllers/AliasController.php, or
  8. remove an alias address via a crafted GET request to <vimbadmin directory>/application/controllers/AliasController.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-6086
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/41967/
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/05/03/7
  • https://github.com/opensolutions/ViMbAdmin/issues/250
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rrmf-fpmm-jpwr

entry.title: [croogo/croogo] Croogo vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting in title field
entry.content:
A stored self-XSS exists in Croogo before v3.0.7, allowing an attacker to execute HTML or JavaScript code in a vulnerable Title field to /admin/file-manager/attachments/edit/4.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7173
  • https://github.com/croogo/croogo/issues/889
  • https://github.com/croogo/croogo/commit/cafaaabe2cef3d1d83652370e30563e6ad7c4158
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q5fg-v5p7-r424

entry.title: [gleez/cms] Gleez CMS Vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting in media/imagecache/resize
entry.content:
An issue was discovered in Gleez CMS v1.2.0. There is XSS via media/imagecache/resize.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-16347
  • https://github.com/gleez/cms/issues/798
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5qqx-32hw-5vx4

entry.title: [gleez/cms] Gleez CMS CSRF Allows Adding of Administrator Accounts
entry.content:
There is a CSRF vulnerability that can add an administrator account in Gleez CMS 1.2.0 via admin/users/add.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-15845
  • https://github.com/gleez/cms/issues/800
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/45258
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-g644-x4hj-cmhq

entry.title: [gleez/cms] Gleez CMS Vulnerability Allows Forced Browsing to Profile Page of Other Users
entry.content:
An issue was discovered in Gleez CMS v1.2.0. Because of an Insecure Direct Object Reference vulnerability, it is possible for attackers (logged in users) to view profile page of other users, as demonstrated by navigating to user/3 on demo.gleezcms.org.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-16704
  • https://github.com/gleez/cms/issues/801
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hh92-wg7v-8vfr

entry.title: [opensolutions/vimbadmin] ViMbAdmin Cross-site Scripting Vulnerabilities
entry.content:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in ViMbAdmin 3.0.15 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the (1) domain or (2) transport parameter to domain/add; the (3) name parameter to mailbox/add/did/; the (4) goto parameter to alias/add/did/; or the (5) captchatext parameter to auth/lost-password.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-5870
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/05/03/8
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20201208133828/https://sysdream.com/news/lab/2017-05-03-cve-2017-5870-multiple-xss-vulnerabilities-in-vimbadmin
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jj4j-cwgq-fx7g

entry.title: [bedita/bedita] BEdita vulnerable to SQL injection
entry.content:
BEdita through 4.0.0-RC2 allows SQL injection during a save operation for a relation with parameters due to a lack of JSON escaping.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-15570
  • https://github.com/bedita/bedita/pull/1608
  • https://github.com/bedita/bedita/commit/0ddcd46d645c773e69369f3ed82c865a4d098454
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9gv2-2m38-j6cx

entry.title: [bagisto/bagisto] Bagisto CSRF Vulnerability
entry.content:
Bagisto before 0.1.5 allows CSRF under /admin URIs.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-14933
  • https://github.com/bagisto/bagisto/issues/750
  • https://github.com/bagisto/bagisto/pull/808
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-pgwp-f3xh-m24g

entry.title: [craftcms/cms] Craft CMS PHP Code Injection Vulnerability
entry.content:
Craft CMS 2.6.3000 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code by using the "Assets->Upload files" screen and then the "Replace it" option, because this allows a .jpg file to have embedded PHP code, and then be renamed to a .php extension.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-3814
  • https://github.com/Snowty/myCVE/blob/master/CraftCMS-2.6.3000/README.md
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20170612231205/http://0day5.com/archives/4122
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r342-vjc4-wrmj

entry.title: [craftcms/cms] Craft CMS Vulnerable to Server-Side Template Injection
entry.content:
Craft CMS through 3.0.34 allows remote authenticated administrators to read sensitive information via server-side template injection, as demonstrated by a {% string for craft.app.config.DB.user and craft.app.config.DB.password in the URI Format of the Site Settings, which causes a cleartext username and password to be displayed in a URI field.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-20465
  • https://github.com/phuctam/Server-Side-Template-Injection-in-CraftCMS-/issues/1
  • https://github.com/craftcms/cms/blob/master/CHANGELOG-v3.md
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j7fx-v37j-v3w7

entry.title: [craftcms/cms] Craft CMS Cross-site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability
entry.content:
index.php?p=admin/actions/entries/save-entry in Craft CMS 3.0.25 allows XSS by saving a new title from the console tab.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-20418
  • https://github.com/rdincel1/Craft-CMS-3.0.25---Cross-Site-Scripting
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20201208014852/https://www.raifberkaydincel.com/craft-cms-3-0-25-cross-site-scripting-vulnerability.html
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/46054
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-72pf-cvwq-vgqg
